## Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in F (Shape: C)

### Introduction:

The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is a captivating and spicy musical entity. Rooted on the note F, played in the C shape, this arpeggio creates a tension-filled and colorful sound due to its raised 5th interval.

### Notes and Intervals:

The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in F consists of the notes F (root), A, C#, and E. The defining interval in this arpeggio is the augmented 5th, which is the C# in this case. This interval adds a unique tension and dissonance to the sound of the arpeggio, giving it a distinct flavor.

### Genre and Musical Flavor:

This arpeggio is often used in jazz and fusion genres to add a sense of tension and excitement to the music. The augmented 5th interval creates a restless and intriguing sound that can add a touch of complexity to chord progressions and improvisations. The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is perfect for adding a bit of edge and unpredictability to solos and compositions.
